body:
Comment 10 by **OlympusRunner**: 
RSC,

Thanks so much. I am now setup and it works. I compiled hello world and I am good to go.

Your instructions were correct. I reread the Go "Getting Started" guide and I added the
environment variables in my .basrc file. Previously, my $GOROOT path would just take me
to the home user folder. Whenever I did a cd $GOROOT, I would just 
get to cd ~

These were the lines I added to my .bashrc file:

#Added lines below for GO Programming language
#06/12/2011

export GOROOT=$HOME/gotest/go
export GOARCH=amd64
export GOOS=linux
export PATH=$PATH:/home/dnukem/gotest/go/bin


It was just weird that if my $GOROOT environment variable was incorrect, why did
everything work up until the "test net" portion of the installation? I figured it would
have given me a nasty message early on about my settings.

Thanks for the help. I will always be a noob.

-OlympusRunner
